sub_title: Student Mechanical Engineering Hanze University of Applied Siences
summary:
Sustainability and the energy transition get a lot of attention at the Hanze University of Applied Science. Our lectures and projects show us how we as mechanical engineers can contribute to this transition. Because of this good amount of thought that is being put into this topic, I found myself inspired to participate in the transition to new and innovative technology. The inventing of a new sustainable energy source as well as optimizing the manufacturing of products are both noble acts I would like to contribute to in the future. Everybody benefits from the developments that are being made in the technological sector. I get satisfaction in being able to perform well and getting challenging assignments. I am proud that I passed the propaedeutic exam within one year with a designation cum laude (average mark 8+/10). My goal is to also finish my bachelor program with the same judicial.

I am currently looking for an internship with a duration of 20 weeks starting per two September 2019. I already had some excursions at different companies and also some projects that gave me an idea of how an engineer operates in practice. Through these projects I have gained skills I expect to use during my internship:
-	Thermal analysis
-	Fluid analysis
-	Designing and analyzing components
-	Strength analysis
-	Statistical Process Control

However, an internship is my chance to finally get some real hands-on experience in a business environment for a longer period of time.

I would like to get some working experience in a foreign country because working abroad is something I myself would very much enjoy in my future job. And staying in a foreign country all by yourself is also a great addition to become an independent adult.

school.name: Hanzehogeschool Groningen / Hanze University of Applied Sciences Groningen

awards.title: passed the propaedeutic exam with a designation cum laude
awards.description: Students receive this designation if they pass the propaedeutic exam with an average mark of 8+/10.

certifications.name: Cambridge English Level 2 Certificate in ESOL International (Advanced)

projects.title: Project Drives systems
projects.description: Here we developed an autonomous cleaning robot that could clean the shorelines to battle the global pollution caused by litter that washes ashore from the sea. I had the responsibility of creating a design for the autonomous control system. I also researched the different technologies that could be used for the autonomous collecting of waste on beaches.

contributors.headline: Student Mechanical Engineering Hanze University of Applied Siences

projects.title: Project Energy systems
projects.description: The goal of this project was to design a house that is fully operated while being entirely off the grid. This design was done by analyzing an existing household located in Finland and modifying it by integrating technologies chosen by the students. During this project I had the role of project leader; here I had to divide the different tasks and plan the course of our project. Analyzing the house it's needs and finding a solution for the energy storage were also my responsibilities.

contributors.headline: Student Mechanical Engineering Hanze University of Applied Siences

projects.title: : Project Pick & Place (Award-winning project 2018 within Mechanical Engineering, the Hanzehogeschool UAS)
projects.description: This project challenged students to build the fastest pick & place machine for filling beer crates in the form of a contest. I had the role of project leader and was responsible for the distribution of tasks and the planning of our project. I also had the task of analyzing different ways of moving loads as fast as possible. I am proud to say our group has won this contest.

contributors.headline: Student Mechanical Engineering Hanze University of Applied Siences

projects.title: Project Can crusher
projects.description: With this project students were asked to build a can crusher that could be used in any household, making the recycling process of cans more effective. My task was to dimension a 3D model in Solidworks and to do a strength analysis of our design.

contributors.headline: Student Mechanical Engineering Hanze University of Applied Siences

projects.title: Project HaRD
projects.description: This project was in cooperation with the Hanze Racing Division; here students were asked to optimize the engine of their race car for an endurance race. In this project, I had the role of project leader which means I was responsible for handing out the tasks. During this project, I was accountable for the thermodynamic analysis of the engine.

contributors.headline: Student Mechanical Engineering Hanze University of Applied Siences

projects.title: Project Hovercraft
projects.description: During this project, an economically running hovercraft was engineered by analyzing a complex datasheet. Here I was accountable for the analysis on the aerodynamic workings of already existing hovercrafts.

contributors.headline: Student Mechanical Engineering Hanze University of Applied Siences

projects.title: Project Bicycle pump
projects.description: By applying reversed engineering, an already-existing bicycle pump needed to be optimized. I had to analyze the thermodynamic effect on pressure loss while compressing air. One of my other responsibilities in this project was the strength analysis.

contributors.headline: Student Mechanical Engineering Hanze University of Applied Siences

profile_positions.description: As a store employee, I had the responsibility of advising clients on their purchase of clothing. I also assisted the store manager in managing the store. By doing this, I became an informal supervisor.
profile_positions.title: shop assistant
